neighborhoods.name: Old Town (Staré Město)
neighborhoods.character: The medieval heart of Prague with cobblestone streets, Gothic architecture, and the famous Astronomical Clock.

location.description: Located on the right bank of the Vltava River, this is the historic center of Prague.

history.overview: Founded in the 9th century, this is Prague's oldest settlement and the original heart of the city.
history.significance: UNESCO World Heritage site and the historic core of Prague for over 1000 years.

practical_info.safety: Very safe with constant tourist activity and police presence.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Early morning to avoid crowds, evening for atmospheric lighting.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent - cobblestone pedestrian areas and compact layout.

attractions.name: Old Town Square
attractions.description: The heart of Prague with colorful baroque buildings, Gothic churches, and the famous Astronomical Clock.
attractions.appeal: Watch the hourly clock show and admire the stunning architecture.

attractions.name: Astronomical Clock
attractions.description: Medieval astronomical clock with animated figures performing every hour.
attractions.appeal: One of the world's oldest working astronomical clocks.

attractions.name: Týn Church
attractions.description: Iconic Gothic church with distinctive twin spires dominating Old Town Square.
attractions.appeal: Beautiful Gothic architecture and significant religious history.

dining.name: Café Savoy
dining.known_for: Elegant Belle Époque atmosphere and traditional dishes

dining.name: Lokál
dining.known_for: Fresh Pilsner Urquell and authentic Czech cuisine

dining.name: U Zlaté studně
dining.known_for: Panoramic city views and gourmet cuisine

activities.name: Historic Walking Tour
activities.description: Explore medieval streets and learn about Prague's rich history.

activities.name: Church and Architecture Tour
activities.description: Visit Gothic and Baroque churches and historic buildings.

stay_here_if: You want to be in the heart of Prague's historic attractions
You love medieval architecture and historic atmosphere
avoid_if: You prefer quieter, less touristy areas
You want modern amenities and nightlife
insider_tips: Visit the Astronomical Clock 10 minutes before the hour for the best viewing spot.
Explore the narrow side streets for hidden courtyards and fewer crowds.

neighborhoods.name: Lesser Town (Malá Strana)
neighborhoods.character: A baroque jewel beneath Prague Castle with palaces, gardens, and charming cobblestone streets.

location.description: Located on the left bank of the Vltava River, beneath Prague Castle.

history.overview: Founded in 1257, this area became the aristocratic quarter with beautiful Baroque palaces.
history.significance: Home to nobility and embassies, featuring the best preserved Baroque architecture in Prague.

transit: Walking distance from Old Town via Charles Bridge
practical_info.safety: Very safe with embassy security and tourist presence.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for peaceful exploration, afternoon for gardens.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent but hilly - comfortable walking shoes recommended.

attractions.name: Charles Bridge
attractions.description: Iconic 14th-century stone bridge with baroque statues and street artists.
attractions.appeal: Prague's most famous landmark with stunning castle views.

attractions.name: St. Nicholas Church
attractions.description: Magnificent Baroque church with impressive dome and frescoes.
attractions.appeal: One of Prague's most beautiful Baroque interiors.

attractions.name: Wallenstein Garden
attractions.description: Beautiful formal garden with peacocks, fountains, and artificial grotto.
attractions.appeal: Peaceful oasis with stunning baroque landscape design.

dining.name: Augustine Restaurant
dining.known_for: Luxury monastery setting and gourmet cuisine

dining.name: Hergetova Cihelna
dining.known_for: Charles Bridge views and modern cuisine

dining.name: U Maltézských rytířů
dining.known_for: Historic cellar dining and traditional dishes

activities.name: Palace and Garden Tour
activities.description: Explore baroque palaces and their beautiful gardens.

activities.name: Charles Bridge Walk
activities.description: Cross the famous bridge and enjoy street performances.

stay_here_if: You appreciate baroque architecture and elegant surroundings
You want proximity to Prague Castle and beautiful gardens
avoid_if: You prefer modern amenities and vibrant nightlife
You want to avoid hills and stairs
insider_tips: Visit the gardens early morning for peaceful atmosphere and best photos.
Look for hidden courtyards and palace gardens open to the public.

neighborhoods.name: New Town (Nové Město)
neighborhoods.character: Prague's bustling commercial and cultural center with wide boulevards, shops, and vibrant nightlife.

location.description: Surrounding the Old Town on three sides, this is Prague's main commercial district.

history.overview: Founded in 1348 by Charles IV, it was one of the largest urban planning projects of medieval Europe.
history.significance: Center of Czech national revival and site of many historic events including the Velvet Revolution.

practical_info.safety: Generally safe but watch for pickpockets in crowded areas.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Evening for nightlife, daytime for shopping and culture.
practical_info.walkability: Very good with wide sidewalks and pedestrian areas.

attractions.name: Wenceslas Square
attractions.description: Prague's main commercial street and site of many historic events.
attractions.appeal: Shopping, dining, and significant historical importance.

attractions.name: National Theatre
attractions.description: Stunning neo-Renaissance building hosting opera, ballet, and drama.

attractions.name: Dancing House
attractions.description: Controversial deconstructivist building designed by Frank Gehry.
attractions.appeal: Striking modern architecture contrasting with historic Prague.

dining.name: Café Slavia
dining.known_for: Historic café with National Theatre views

activities.name: Shopping on Wenceslas Square
activities.description: Explore Prague's main shopping street and department stores.

activities.name: National Theatre Performance
activities.description: Attend opera, ballet, or drama at Prague's premier venue.

stay_here_if: You want to be near shopping, dining, and cultural venues
You enjoy vibrant urban atmosphere and nightlife
avoid_if: You want to avoid crowds and traffic
insider_tips: Book National Theatre tickets well in advance for popular performances.
Explore the art nouveau buildings along the main streets.

neighborhoods.name: Castle Quarter (Hradčany)
neighborhoods.character: The royal quarter surrounding Prague Castle with magnificent views, palaces, and gardens.

location.description: Located on a hill above Lesser Town, centered around Prague Castle.

history.overview: Historic seat of Czech rulers for over 1000 years, center of political and religious power.
history.significance: Home to Prague Castle, the largest ancient castle complex in the world.
notable_events: Founding of Prague Castle in 9th century
Seat of Czechoslovak and Czech presidents

practical_info.safety: Very safe with castle security and tourist police.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Early morning to avoid crowds, late afternoon for golden light.
practical_info.walkability: Good but very hilly - expect steep climbs and stairs.

attractions.name: Prague Castle
attractions.description: The largest ancient castle in the world with palaces, churches, and gardens.
attractions.appeal: Over 1000 years of Czech history in one magnificent complex.

attractions.name: St. Vitus Cathedral
attractions.description: Magnificent Gothic cathedral with stunning stained glass and royal tombs.
attractions.appeal: Masterpiece of Gothic architecture and spiritual heart of Czech Republic.

attractions.name: Royal Gardens
attractions.description: Beautiful Renaissance gardens with seasonal flowers and historic buildings.
attractions.appeal: Peaceful gardens with stunning views and historic architecture.

dining.name: U Černého vola
dining.known_for: Authentic local atmosphere and cheap beer

activities.name: Prague Castle Tour
activities.description: Explore the castle complex, cathedral, and royal apartments.

activities.name: Castle Gardens Walk
activities.description: Stroll through beautiful Renaissance and Baroque gardens.

stay_here_if: You want to be near Prague Castle and historic sites
You enjoy panoramic views and don't mind walking uphill
avoid_if: You have mobility issues or prefer flat terrain
You want vibrant nightlife and dining options
insider_tips: Buy castle tickets online to skip lines, especially in summer.
Visit Royal Gardens in spring for the best flower displays.

neighborhoods.name: Vinohrady
neighborhoods.character: An elegant residential neighborhood with beautiful Art Nouveau architecture, parks, and a local atmosphere.

location.description: Located southeast of New Town, this is Prague's most desirable residential area.

history.overview: Former royal vineyards transformed into an elegant residential district in the 19th century.
history.significance: Prague's premier residential area known for Art Nouveau architecture and upscale living.

practical_info.safety: Very safe residential area with low crime rates.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Any time - great for morning walks and evening dining.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent with tree-lined streets and sidewalks.

attractions.name: Náměstí Míru
attractions.description: Beautiful square with Church of St. Ludmila and Art Nouveau buildings.
attractions.appeal: Perfect example of Prague's residential elegance and architecture.

attractions.name: Riegrovy sady
attractions.description: Large park with beer garden, playground, and stunning city views.
attractions.appeal: Popular local hangout with the best beer garden views in Prague.

attractions.name: Náměstí Jiřího z Poděbrad
attractions.description: Farmers market square with modernist church and local atmosphere.
attractions.appeal: Saturday farmers market and authentic local neighborhood feel.

dining.name: Café Louvre
dining.known_for: Historic café where Einstein and Kafka met

activities.name: Art Nouveau Architecture Walk
activities.description: Explore beautiful Art Nouveau buildings and residential streets.

activities.name: Riegrovy sady Beer Garden
activities.description: Enjoy Czech beer with locals while overlooking the city.

stay_here_if: You want to experience local Prague life away from tourist crowds
You appreciate elegant architecture and peaceful residential areas
avoid_if: You want to be walking distance from major tourist attractions
You prefer vibrant nightlife and entertainment districts
insider_tips: Visit the Saturday farmers market at Náměstí Jiřího z Poděbrad for local products.
The beer garden at Riegrovy sady offers the best sunset views in Prague.

neighborhoods.name: Jewish Quarter (Josefov)
neighborhoods.character: A historically significant district preserving nearly 1000 years of Jewish heritage in Central Europe.

location.description: Located between Old Town Square and the Vltava River, within Old Town.

history.overview: One of Europe's oldest Jewish settlements, preserving nearly a millennium of Jewish culture and history.
history.significance: Contains the oldest active synagogue in Europe and one of the world's oldest Jewish cemeteries.
notable_events: Establishment of Jewish community in 10th century

transit: Walking distance from Old Town Square
practical_info.safety: Very safe with museum security and tourist presence.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for quieter museum visits, closed on Saturdays and Jewish holidays.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent - compact area within Old Town.

attractions.name: Old Jewish Cemetery
attractions.description: One of the oldest Jewish cemeteries in Europe with over 12,000 tombstones.
attractions.appeal: Deeply moving historical site with centuries of Jewish history.

attractions.name: Old-New Synagogue
attractions.description: The oldest active synagogue in Europe, built in 1270.
attractions.appeal: Stunning Gothic architecture and continuous religious use for 750 years.

attractions.name: Jewish Museum
attractions.description: Comprehensive museum preserving Jewish history and culture in Bohemia.
attractions.appeal: World's largest collection of Jewish artifacts outside Israel.

dining.name: King Solomon
dining.known_for: Kosher cuisine and Jewish cultural atmosphere

dining.name: Café Slavia
dining.known_for: Historic meeting place and Prague views

activities.name: Jewish Heritage Tour
activities.description: Comprehensive tour of synagogues, cemetery, and museum.

activities.name: Synagogue Visits
activities.description: Visit multiple historic synagogues and learn about Jewish traditions.

stay_here_if: You're interested in Jewish history and culture
You want to be in the historic center with easy access to cultural sites
avoid_if: You're looking for vibrant nightlife and entertainment
You prefer modern amenities and contemporary atmosphere
insider_tips: Buy combination tickets for all synagogues and the cemetery for better value.
Respect the solemn nature of the sites and dress appropriately.
